doc.previous: Most passerines are smaller than typical members of other avian orders. The superb lyrebird and some birds-of-paradise, due to very long tails or tail coverts, are longer overall. The smallest passerine is the short-tailed pygmy tyrant, at 6.5Â cm (2.6Â in) and 4.2Â g (0.15Â oz).
